title: The Power of a Sip of Water
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told a story of a man who was walking on a road and became very thirsty. He found a well, climbed down, and drank. When he came out, he saw a panting dog eating mud out of extreme thirst. The man thought, 'This dog is as thirsty as I was.' So he climbed back down, filled his shoe with water, and gave it to the dog. Allah thanked him for this deed and forgave his sins.

title: The Woman Who Cleaned the Mosque
content: A black woman used to clean the mosque during the time of the Prophet (ﷺ). One day, the Prophet did not see her and asked about her. The companions said, 'She has died.' He said, 'Why did you not inform me?' He went to her grave and prayed the funeral prayer for her, showing that even the simplest service to Allah's house is honored.

title: The Weight of Good Character
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Nothing is heavier on the Scale of the believer on the Day of Resurrection than good character. For indeed Allah hates the one who is rude and vulgar.'

title: Do Not Belittle Good Deeds
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Do not belittle any good deed, even meeting your brother with a cheerful face.'

title: The Man Who Killed 99 People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told of a man who killed 99 people but sought repentance. He was told to go to a town of righteous people. He died halfway there. The angels of mercy and punishment argued over him. Allah commanded the earth to shift, making him closer to the righteous town by a handspan, and he was forgiven.

title: Mercy to the Universe
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) recited the verse where Ibrahim (AS) prayed for his people, and the verse where Isa (AS) prayed for his people. Then he raised his hands and said, 'O Allah! My Ummah! My Ummah!' and he wept. Allah sent Jibril to say: 'We will please you with regard to your Ummah and We will not disappoint you.'

title: Half a Date
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Guard yourselves against the Fire, even with half a date (given in charity). And if you cannot find that, then with a kind word.'

title: The Best of You
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The best of you are those who learn the Quran and teach it.'

title: Visiting the Sick
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When a Muslim visits his sick brother, he is harvesting the fruits of Paradise until he returns.'

title: Love for Your Brother
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.'
